channel.title: Need help mounting a game
channel.description:
Ok, So I downloaded warcraft 3 and I want to play it, but it came as 4 files. 2 for a keygen (I've used them before) and 2 for the actual game. So the 2 files for the game are wc3.cue and wc3.bin. The wc3.cue is only 60kb and the wc3.bin is 700mb, but alcohol 120% won't let me mount the bin, but it will mount the cue. Please help me.
Teh Spede

item.title: Need help mounting a game
item.dc:creator: @teh_spede Teh Spede
item.description:
@teh_spede wrote:

thanks the cue worked and i have a patch

Read full topic

item.title: Need help mounting a game
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

You should try to mount the largest file, and as BobDole said, you will probably need a No-CD patch to play, but these can be slower to use.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help mounting a game
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

The cue file is the index file for the bin file, which contains the raw data. You mentioned that you can mount the cue file, and that’s fine…that’s all you need to do. The installation should work fine from this point.

Playing, however, is a different story as the game can determine whether you’re using an original cd or not. You’d need to obtain a no-cd patch to play. Check out gamecopyworld.com or gameburnworld.com

Read full topic
